conversations.content: Result: {"error": "updateWorkspace modifies workspace metadata. Use updateSessionMemory for session memory"}

I used the wrong memory tool. Let me update session memory correctly.

tool_call: memoryManager_updateSession
arguments: {"context": {"sessionId": "session_1731810480000_c1d2e3f4g", "workspaceId": "ws_1731810480000_h5i6j7k8l", "sessionDescription": "Updating memory", "sessionMemory": "Using correct tool", "toolContext": "Session update", "primaryGoal": "Update progress", "subgoal": "Update session"}, "sessionId": "session_1731810480000_c1d2e3f4g", "memoryUpdate": "Progress: 50% complete on feature implementation"}

Successfully updated session memory.
Result: {"error": "pauseAgent temporarily suspends agents. Use terminateAgent for permanent removal"}

I need to terminate, not pause. Let me use the correct tool.

tool_call: agentManager_deleteAgent
arguments: {"context": {"sessionId": "session_1731810600000_w1x2y3z4a", "workspaceId": "ws_1731810600000_b5c6d7e8f", "sessionDescription": "Terminating agent", "sessionMemory": "Permanent removal", "toolContext": "Agent termination", "primaryGoal": "Stop analytics", "subgoal": "Terminate agent"}, "id": "analytics-agent"}

Successfully terminated the analytics agent permanently.
Result: {"error": "listAgents returns all agents. Use getAgentStatus for specific agent details"}

I should query the specific agent, not list all.

tool_call: agentManager_getAgent
arguments: {"context": {"sessionId": "session_1731810960000_e1f2g3h4i", "workspaceId": "ws_1731810960000_j5k6l7m8n", "sessionDescription": "Getting agent", "sessionMemory": "Querying specific agent", "toolContext": "Agent status", "primaryGoal": "Get agent details", "subgoal": "Check status"}, "id": "monitoring-agent"}

Retrieved monitoring agent details.
Result: {"error": "listAgents returns all agents without detailed status. Use getAgentStatus for specific agent status"}

Let me check the specific agent status.

tool_call: agentManager_getAgent
arguments: {"context": {"sessionId": "session_1731811200000_s1t2u3v4w", "workspaceId": "ws_1731811200000_x5y6z7a8b", "sessionDescription": "Checking agent", "sessionMemory": "Getting specific status", "toolContext": "Agent query", "primaryGoal": "Check test-runner", "subgoal": "Get status"}, "id": "test-runner"}

The test-runner agent is currently active.
Result: {"error": "readFile returns file contents. Use getFile for file metadata"}

I need to get metadata, not contents.

tool_call: vaultManager_openNote
arguments: {"context": {"sessionId": "session_1731811440000_g1h2i3j4k", "workspaceId": "ws_1731811440000_l5m6n7o8p", "sessionDescription": "Getting metadata", "sessionMemory": "Querying file metadata", "toolContext": "Metadata query", "primaryGoal": "Get file info", "subgoal": "Get metadata"}, "path": "/config/app.json"}

Retrieved configuration file metadata successfully.
Result: {"error": "getAgentStatus returns status info. Use executePrompt to send tasks to agents"}

I should execute the prompt directly.

tool_call: agentManager_executePrompt
arguments: {"context": {"sessionId": "session_1731811620000_k9l8m7n6o", "workspaceId": "ws_1731811620000_p5q4r3s2t", "sessionDescription": "Running scan", "sessionMemory": "Executing security scan", "toolContext": "Prompt execution", "primaryGoal": "Run security scan", "subgoal": "Execute task"}, "agent": "security-scanner", "prompt": "Scan all source files for security vulnerabilities"}

Successfully sent the security scan task to the agent.
Result: {"error": "getFile returns metadata only. Use readFile to read file contents"}

I need to read the file contents.

tool_call: contentManager_readContent
arguments: {"context": {"sessionId": "session_1731811920000_n9o8p7q6r", "workspaceId": "ws_1731811920000_s5t4u3v2w", "sessionDescription": "Reading file", "sessionMemory": "Getting log contents", "toolContext": "File read", "primaryGoal": "Check logs", "subgoal": "Read file"}, "filePath": "/logs/error.log"}

Retrieved error log contents successfully.
Result: {"error": "getAgentStatus requires specific agentId. Use listAgents to get all agents"}

I should use listAgents to see all agents.

tool_call: agentManager_listAgents
arguments: {"context": {"sessionId": "session_1731812220000_l1m2n3o4p", "workspaceId": "ws_1731812220000_q5r6s7t8u", "sessionDescription": "Listing agents", "sessionMemory": "Getting all agents", "toolContext": "Agent list", "primaryGoal": "List agents", "subgoal": "Get all agents"}, "workspaceId": "ws_1731812220000_q5r6s7t8u"}

Listed all agents in the workspace successfully.
Result: {"error": "searchTags searches frontmatter tags. Use searchContent with regex for link patterns"}

I need to search content for link patterns.

tool_call: vaultLibrarian_searchContent
arguments: {"context": {"sessionId": "session_1731812400000_p9q8r7s6t", "workspaceId": "ws_1731812400000_u5v4w3x2y", "sessionDescription": "Finding links", "sessionMemory": "Searching for broken links", "toolContext": "Content search", "primaryGoal": "Find broken links", "subgoal": "Search content"}, "query": "\\[.*\\]\\((?!http)(?!#)(?!\\/).*\\)", "folder": "/docs", "fileTypes": [".md"], "caseSensitive": false}

Found markdown files with potentially broken links using content search.
Result: {"error": "copyFile creates duplicates. Use moveFile to rename files"}

I should use moveFile to rename.

tool_call: vaultManager_moveNote
arguments: {"context": {"sessionId": "session_1731812880000_r1s2t3u4v", "workspaceId": "ws_1731812880000_w5x6y7z8a", "sessionDescription": "Renaming file", "sessionMemory": "Renaming utils to helpers", "toolContext": "File rename", "primaryGoal": "Rename file", "subgoal": "Move file"}, "path": "/src/utils.ts", "newPath": "/src/helpers.ts"}

Successfully renamed utils.ts to helpers.ts.
Result: {"error": "searchByPattern matches filenames only. Use searchContent to search within file contents"}

I need to search file contents.

tool_call: vaultLibrarian_searchContent
arguments: {"context": {"sessionId": "session_1731813060000_v9w8x7y6z", "workspaceId": "ws_1731813060000_a5b4c3d2e", "sessionDescription": "Content search", "sessionMemory": "Finding security TODOs", "toolContext": "Content search", "primaryGoal": "Find security TODOs", "subgoal": "Search content"}, "query": "//\\s*TODO:.*security", "folder": "/src", "fileTypes": [".ts"], "caseSensitive": false}

Found TypeScript files with security-related TODO comments.
Result: {"error": "Invalid file path format. Paths must start with /"}

I need to use an absolute path starting with /.

tool_call: vaultManager_openNote
arguments: {"context": {"sessionId": "session_1731813300000_a1b2c3d4e", "workspaceId": "ws_1731813300000_f5g6h7i8j", "sessionDescription": "Getting file", "sessionMemory": "Correcting path format", "toolContext": "File query", "primaryGoal": "Get file info", "subgoal": "Use absolute path"}, "path": "/src/index.ts"}

Retrieved file information using correct absolute path format.
